name: demolish
content:
demolish verb [T]
(DESTROY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B2 to completely destroy a building, especially in order to use the land for something else: A number of houses were demolished so that the supermarket could be built.
C2 to prove that an argument or theory is wrong: He completely demolished all her arguments.
More examplesFewer examplesThe building had to be demolished because of subsidence.One by one the old buildings in the city have been demolished and replaced with modern tower blocks.The explosion virtually demolished several nearby houses.You've demolished my lovely arrangement - now I'll have to do it all over again!Our greenhouse was demolished in last night's storm.
